comments: Seems to be invertible like n*Phi(n). Compare with A002618, A038040.
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(n) = n*(n-EulerPhi(n)) = n^2-n*Phi(n) = Cototient(n^2) = A051953(A000290(n)).a(n) = n^2 - A002618(n).a(n) = n*cototient(n) = n*A051953(n). _Omar E. Pol_, Nov 22 2012
example: For n = prime p, Cototient(p)=1 and a(p)=p.
prog: (PARI) a(n) = n^2 - eulerphi(n^2) \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jul 27 2013(Haskell)a053650 = a051953 . a000290  -- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jan 21 2014
author: _Labos Elemer_, Feb 18 2000
